text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires stating that the Northern Ireland Protocol (as enacted, which the answer correctly links to the initial framework before the Windsor amendments clarified the system) included a presumption that all NI-bound goods are 'at risk' of onward EU import, unless the importer proves otherwise. The candidate answer explicitly states under 'The 'At Risk' Test': 'DEFAULT POSITION: Goods are presumed to be \"at risk\" of entering the EU market UNLESS proven otherwise.'
